rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative modifying a risk-adjective.
statement_text: ABPA President Ricardo Santin praised Brazil's ability to protect its commercial poultry farms after the avian influenza virus killed wild birds, sea mammals and backyard animals. He [Ricardo Santin] cautioned, however, that farmers and companies will have to learn how to live with the disease, saying 'the virus will be around all the time.'

rationale: 'killed' is factual, 'cautioned' is not high-potency, and 'around all the time' is not high-potency.
